title: Development Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UJA-Federation of New York
Interview Descriptions: 3 rounds - first with HR, second with the manager, and third with the director and team. From start to finish, the process was fast although the interview rounds felt somewhat rigid.
Interview Questions: - what about UJA's work and mission most resonates with you? -How do you manage working with donors that have strong personalities?

title: Program Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UJA-Federation of New York
Interview Descriptions: I had a first interview with HR with some standard interview questions and assessing my interest. Then for the specific position, I had an interview with my potential supervisor and other members of the team. The interviewers were kind and friendly. Spent most of the time teaching me about the position and the work that the team does, very little time asking actual questions about myself or my interests.
Interview Questions: What kinds of work I'm hoping to do?

title: Development Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UJA-Federation of New York
Interview Descriptions: Pleasant  but did not offer enough money for relocation so did not continue with the interview process.  Responded quickly to my application through the online portal and set up an interview within the week of submitting an application.
Interview Questions: Strenths and Weaknesses, reasons for applying, past work experience

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UJA-Federation of New York (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: very responsive and fast, first a phone screening and then two in person interviews with people of various titles.  HR checked in between each meeting to give and get feedback.
Interview Questions: how do you handle difficult people

title: Salesforce Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at UJA-Federation of New York (Toronto, ON) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Quite straight forward and there were administration questions and apex related question and also few api , master detail and process builder. And also vlookup .overall it's fairly simple. Not too complex

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UJA-Federation of New York
Interview Descriptions: Applied through NYU CLIP, which was it's own application process. Then had an interview with UJA. Very straightforward and informational gauging your interest. It was on the phone and all behavioral.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UJA-Federation of New York (New York, NY) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: they called me right away for the first round and the second round was the same day! they also look less than 24 hours to let me know I got the job
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses

title: Quality Assurance Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at UJA-Federation of New York (New York, NY) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very pleasant interview; was immediately put at ease by HR person. No difficult questions, unless you count the old saw: What is your biggest weakness? The answers about why the position was open frankly frightened me. The words were innocent-sounding and neutrally delivered but the backstory was all too clear - and I thought: no thank you.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness? (Sigh. Really?)

title: Technical Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UJA-Federation of New York (New York, NY) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Was called for 4 interviews. Haven't heard from them for more than a month. Send an email to the position's direct supervisor to find out the status. No response. 
What happened to courtesy?

title: Manager, Jewish Network News Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UJA-Federation of New York
Interview Descriptions: Met with HR personal and then hiring manager. Was a great experience. Also met with employee who had the job and other colleagues. had a chance to really get to know many people in the department.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at UJA-Federation of New York
Interview Descriptions: A protracted process. Met with HR and then the team and potential boss. Also at a senior level, you may meet with the members of the executive team, including the CEO. You also will go through a security/background check before being hired. And, they ask for many references.
Interview Questions: When meeting with the CEO, he asked about what my "Jewish Journey" was and why I wanted to come on board to the UJA-Federation. While innocently asked, it was a bit uncomfortable as I had never been asked a personal question on a job interview before.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UJA-Federation of New York
Interview Descriptions: sending in a cover letter and resume, they contacted me to set up an interview. First interview was an hour long followed by two thirty min interviews with supervisors and their supervisors.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with everyone coming to you needing their stuff done all at once?

title: Development Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UJA-Federation of New York (New York, NY) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews. One with HR one with Manager

title: Fundraiser Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UJA-Federation of New York (New York, NY) in Sept 2009
Interview Descriptions: Company is basically looking to see how committed you are and whether you work overtime and/or stay late.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you went above and beyond for a company.
